channel.title: Holy crap. We are small!
channel.description:
[img]http://static.funnyjunk.com/gifs/wearestardust2.gif[/img]
I was on a a site surfing through funny pictures. Then I came across this. I was like 0.0

item.title: Holy crap. We are small!
item.dc:creator: @Reisyukaku Reisyukaku
item.description:
@Reisyukaku wrote:

[quote="–BBLLAARRGGHH–, post:79, topic:303780"][quote author=Reisyukaku link=topic=400064.msg2971619#msg2971619 date=1253993169]

[quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=400064.msg2971536#msg2971536 date=1253988648]

Guys, you have to think, not everything you are told is correct. Alot of science things are just (clever, and most probably correct) guesses. Nobody knows the size of the universe, or what an atom looks like. We can’t tell how many universes there are, or how it started/will end. These things are currently impossible to truly know.

Hmmm… That is true. Here’s something to think about; we’re constantly asking questions about the universe, how it was made, what it’s here for, what was before it, the formation of stars, etc. And, apparently, we’re all supposedly made of stars, yes? (Link here about that: http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20080201000521AAGAe4E)

So really, if we’re made out of stars, and there’s all these questions about how the universe came about and such, then why don’t we all know automatically know already how the universe was formed? Are all of these questions just us questioning ourselves?
[/quote] Alot of people say we’re made from ‘stars’ for a few reasons, some ones that I believe are:

  1. Our sun, was formed from an even larger star, which ‘exploded’. I’m unsure of the next bit, but somehow, the planets were also formed here, making humans made from stars
  2. Not really stars, but another is: Earth started with NO life whatsoever. At some point a foreign space object crashed into earth, with living bacteria on it. this then went through evolution…blah blah…and made us. This theory also supports the argument of ‘aliens’ or life out of earth.

plausable, i like this theory, can produce any evidence?

Here is what i believe:
A big star exploded and all the pieces scattered everywhere (this was known as the big bang). All the pieces became round because of its own gravity. The larger masses have larger gravity so therefore it pulled the smaller masses towards it and some of the smaller masses started orbiting the larger ones because of the slingshot effect, and thats why planets have moons and thats how our solar system was made. THE END
[/quote] That’s quite good. Only thing I can question about this is, where did the big star come from to start this all off?
(I like to ask questions, It extends my knowledge, makes me think, and can really piss somebody off if used correctly :P)[/quote]
your basically asking what happened before the big bang, well, even scientists dont know that yet… lol. The big bang theory its self has anomalies so… ya, thats why scientist are trying to come up with a unified physics (Einstein was working on unified phyiscs before he died). Unified physics will be able to explain how the universe work and how anything and everything works.

Read full topic

item.title: Holy crap. We are small!
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote="–BBLLAARRGGHH–, post:81, topic:303780"][quote author=h4x0r88 link=topic=400064.msg2972708#msg2972708 date=1254064029]

[quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=400064.msg2971335#msg2971335 date=1253980934]

We’re made of Carbon, which is what ALOT of things are made of…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 25, 2009, 09:36:05 pm[/size][hr][quote author=`Aaron link=topic=400064.msg2970752#msg2970752 date=1253935971]

You obviously show no respect to those who have made the world what it is today.

I seriously doubt that the CEO of Mcdonalds has really helped the United States.
[/quote]I seriously doubt we would be on this website, on our computers, if it weren’t for scientists.

Wrong we are carbon based, carbon compounds bonded with hydrogen, oxygen, helium and nitrogen, when things burn the bonds are broken and the element carbon is a product.
[/quote]I said we were carbon based?

No you said were made of carbon there is a difference
[/quote]No, there isn’t… I never said we were completely made of Carbon.

We’re made of Carbon, which is what ALOT of things are made of…
No you said were made of carbon. I CAN read.
[/quote]Listen… I know you like to argue but I never said “We’re entirely made of Carbon, which is what ALOT of things are entirely made of…”

Theory time!
We could be hydrogen based, as some scientists believe that the ‘big bang’ gave off the very first element, hydrogen. these had gravity, so they pulled together, until there were GIGANTIC amounts of it, which made it so heavy, they fused together, to make helium. And so on to make other elements etc.

NOTE: Hydrogen is No. 1 in the periodic table, Helium being number 2.[/quote]
duh hydrogen having the smallest atomic mass with 1 electron. and elements don’t" “fuse” they react you correct scientific terminology.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 27-09-2009, 18:51:10[/size][hr][quote=“Jamie1200, post:69, topic:303780”][quote author=h4x0r88 link=topic=400064.msg2970754#msg2970754 date=1253936040]
We’re made of Carbon, which is what ALOT of things are made of…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 25, 2009, 09:36:05 pm[/size][hr][quote author=`Aaron link=topic=400064.msg2970752#msg2970752 date=1253935971]

You obviously show no respect to those who have made the world what it is today.

I seriously doubt that the CEO of Mcdonalds has really helped the United States.
[/quote]I seriously doubt we would be on this website, on our computers, if it weren’t for scientists.

Wrong we are carbon based, carbon compounds bonded with hydrogen, oxygen, helium and nitrogen, when things burn the bonds are broken and the element carbon is a product.[/quote]
We’re made of carbon gives me the impression that were made entiry of carbon, which it looks like, If want to agrue about we can, I’m up for a scientfic argument, There is a difference when it comes to science.

Read full topic

item.title: Holy crap. We are small!
item.dc:creator: @_BBLLAARRGGHH __--BBLLAARRGGHH--__
item.description:
@_BBLLAARRGGHH wrote:

[quote=“Reisyukaku, post:77, topic:303780”][quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=400064.msg2971536#msg2971536 date=1253988648]

Guys, you have to think, not everything you are told is correct. Alot of science things are just (clever, and most probably correct) guesses. Nobody knows the size of the universe, or what an atom looks like. We can’t tell how many universes there are, or how it started/will end. These things are currently impossible to truly know.

Hmmm… That is true. Here’s something to think about; we’re constantly asking questions about the universe, how it was made, what it’s here for, what was before it, the formation of stars, etc. And, apparently, we’re all supposedly made of stars, yes? (Link here about that: http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20080201000521AAGAe4E)

So really, if we’re made out of stars, and there’s all these questions about how the universe came about and such, then why don’t we all know automatically know already how the universe was formed? Are all of these questions just us questioning ourselves?
[/quote] Alot of people say we’re made from ‘stars’ for a few reasons, some ones that I believe are:

  1. Our sun, was formed from an even larger star, which ‘exploded’. I’m unsure of the next bit, but somehow, the planets were also formed here, making humans made from stars
  2. Not really stars, but another is: Earth started with NO life whatsoever. At some point a foreign space object crashed into earth, with living bacteria on it. this then went through evolution…blah blah…and made us. This theory also supports the argument of ‘aliens’ or life out of earth.

plausable, i like this theory, can produce any evidence?

Here is what i believe:
A big star exploded and all the pieces scattered everywhere (this was known as the big bang). All the pieces became round because of its own gravity. The larger masses have larger gravity so therefore it pulled the smaller masses towards it and some of the smaller masses started orbiting the larger ones because of the slingshot effect, and thats why planets have moons and thats how our solar system was made. THE END :)[/quote] That’s quite good. Only thing I can question about this is, where did the big star come from to start this all off?
(I like to ask questions, It extends my knowledge, makes me think, and can really piss somebody off if used correctly :P)

Nobody knows the size of the universe, or what an atom looks like. We can’t tell how many universes there are, or how it started/will end. These things are currently impossible to truly know.

Hmmm… That is true. Here’s something to think about; we’re constantly asking questions about the universe, how it was made, what it’s here for, what was before it, the formation of stars, etc. And, apparently, we’re all supposedly made of stars, yes? So really, if we’re made out of stars, and there’s all these questions about how the universe came about and such, then why don’t we all know automatically know already how the universe was formed? Are all of these questions just us questioning ourselves?

  1. Our sun, was formed from an even larger star, which ‘exploded’. I’m unsure of the next bit, but somehow, the planets were also formed here, making humans made from stars
  2. Not really stars, but another is: Earth started with NO life whatsoever. At some point a foreign space object crashed into earth, with living bacteria on it. this then went through evolution…blah blah…and made us. This theory also supports the argument of ‘aliens’ or life out of earth.

plausable, i like this theory, can produce any evidence?[/quote]
Here is what i believe:
A big star exploded and all the pieces scattered everywhere (this was known as the big bang). All the pieces became round because of its own gravity. The larger masses have larger gravity so therefore it pulled the smaller masses towards it and some of the smaller masses started orbiting the larger ones because of the slingshot effect, and thats why planets have moons and thats how our solar system was made. THE END

item.title: Holy crap. We are small!
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“h4x0r88, post:66, topic:303780”]We’re made of Carbon, which is what ALOT of things are made of…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 25, 2009, 09:36:05 pm[/size][hr][quote author=`Aaron link=topic=400064.msg2970752#msg2970752 date=1253935971]

You obviously show no respect to those who have made the world what it is today.

I seriously doubt that the CEO of Mcdonalds has really helped the United States.
[/quote]I seriously doubt we would be on this website, on our computers, if it weren’t for scientists.[/quote]

That’s correct, computers have really made a difference on the way we visit things. Scientists have some good ideas.
